Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: ALIENS INSIDE US
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Every one of us teems with trillions of microorganisms. Some of these microbes are what we call "germs," but many more of them are actually good for us. Discover the health benefits of having aliens inside us, and see how those benefits are being threatened by our modern, sterile lifestyles.

Clip.Title: COSMIC VISTAS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The gas giants of the outer solar system, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune, represent very different kind of planets, with exotic atmospheres, liquid interiors and rings.

Clip.Title: COSMIC VISTAS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Looking to beyond the rocky and gaseous worlds, to the dark domain of Pluto and beyond, we may find the history of the solar system preserved for us in a deep freeze.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Discover the health benefits of having aliens inside us, and see how those benefits are being threatened by our modern, sterile lifestyles.

Clip.Title: MAGNIFICA ITALIA
Clip.Episode: From Isola di Dino to Reggio Calabria
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Isola di Dino to Reggio Calabria, travel along the Ionic coast looking for the historical roots of Calabria from the ancient column of Hera Lacinia to Locri up until the wild landscapes of Aspromonte.

Clip.Title: MAGNIFICA ITALIA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Pentedattilo to Sibari we continue our journey on the beautiful Tirrenic Coast, from the cliffs of Capo Vaticano to the charming sea town of Tropea.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An aerial survey of world famous Cape Breton Island reveals why this has been called the "world's greatest road trip" - from the Canso Causeway to the Cape Breton Highlands - the island is a world unto its own.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: ALIENS INSIDE US
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Every one of us teems with trillions of microorganisms. Some of these microbes are what we call "germs," but many more of them are actually good for us. Discover the health benefits of having aliens inside us, and see how those benefits are being threatened by our modern, sterile lifestyles.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet must perform surgery to save a dog with a groundbreaking operation to replace his foot with a prosthetic and a second dog with a dislocation.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: At the eastern tip of Papua New Guinea lies a marine paradise made up of 600 remote islands. These distant islands far offshore are surrounded by countless pristine coral reefs. Just beneath the sea - life abounds. With over 1,500 species of fish... every single nook and cranny on the reefs are inhabited and exploited.

Clip.Title: GREENPEACE: THE STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: As the world began to view the environmental damage caused by human beings, a determined group gathered in Vancouver to see what they could do about it and the result became the most recognizable group of environmental crusaders on Earth.

Clip.Title: BLACK MAMBA: KISS OF DEATH
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The bite of the black mamba is known by South African locals as the "kiss of death." A single strike can deliver enough neurotoxic venom to kill 15 grown men. It has one of Africa's worst reputations, but does it deserve its bad rap? Behind the bad press lies a mercurial reptile that is quite shy. Follow a female mamba looking for a home to incubate her eggs while avoiding her main enemy: humans. Then join snake bounty hunter Simon Keys, whose black mamba sanctuary offers a unique look at the secret behavior of this much-maligned snake.

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: At the Smithsonian, science and history - and even art and design - are used to help predict the future. Join host Tom Cavanagh as we look at designers who have shaped our future, sneak a peek at museum of the future, and talk to scientists helping to preserve the future of the tropical rainforest.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Little parts of our world disappear every day. Join host, Tom Cavanagh as learns what Smithsonian experts are doing to protect the best aspects of our world for future generations using "extreme conservation."

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Based on Stone's own experiences as a soldier in the conflict, "Platoon" captivated millions of viewers all over the world. But how much of the film was real and how much was Hollywood fiction? To reveal the real story, we recreate scenes; uncover a radio transmission from the battle that inspired the movie's climax, and interview writer/director Oliver Stone and cast member Willem Dafoe.

Clip.Title: 40 UNDER 40
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Go behind the scenes of the "40 under 40: Craft Futures" exhibition, featuring traditional and non-traditional works of decorative art created by the top 40 American craft artists under the age of 40.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: At the Smithsonian, science and history - and even art and design - are used to help predict the future.
